title: Senior Systems Administrator II - G...
content: Shall have 5 or more years of hands-on experience providing O&M support of enterprise server operating systems (OSs) (Windows Server, Red Hat Enterprise Linux, etc.) and server applications and services across multi-platform information systems varying in size and complexity (LAN, MAN, WAN, etc.). Shall have 3 or more years of experience specifically related to providing O&M to Multi-Level Security (MLS) and/or CDS implementations, integrations, accreditations, and operations. Shall have 3 or more years of hands-on experience working with Linux-based platforms. Specific experience with RHEL 6 and/or 7 is a plus. Shall have 3 or more years of experience operating and maintaining solutions in secure processing environments which must adhere to U.S. Government Information Assurance and Security standards such as the Defense Information Systems Agency (DISA) Security Requirements Guides (SRGs) and Security Technical Implementation Guides (STIGs). Demonstrated experience of having a strong understanding of core IT Networking protocols, including but may not be limited to, SSH, SCP, FTP, SSL, PKI, VPN, SNMP, etc. Bachelor’s Degree from an Accredited University. Shall possess GIAC Security Essentials (GSEC) or Security+ Continuing Education (CE) or Systems Security Certified Practitioner (SSCP) to meet the minimum credential requirements for Cyber IT/Cybersecurity Workforce (CSWF) as outlined in SECNAV M-5239.2. Strongly desired to be at least Red Hat Certified Systems Administrator (RHCSA) certified. Red Hat Certified Engineer (RHCE) certification is most desired. Strongly desired to be Global Information Assurance Certification (GIAC) Certified UNIX Security Administrator (GCUX) and/or GIAC Certified Windows Security Administrator (GCWN) certified. Strongly desired to be Microsoft Certified: Modem Desktop Administrator Associate or Microsoft Certified Solutions Associate (MCSA): Windows 10 certified. Strongly desired to be Microsoft Certified Solutions Associate (MCSA): Windows Server 2016 certified. Strongly desired to have experience working with Microsoft Windows 7 and 10 enterprise desktop offerings as clients within virtual, and ideally specifically CDS, implementations. Experience with enterprise Windows Server 2012 or newer is also a plus. Demonstrated experience authoring, testing, troubleshooting, and implementing scripted technologies, such as Microsoft PowerShell on Linux, Bash, Perl, Python, etc., to automate and orchestrate routine, as well as complex, O&M duties and responsibilities, with a focus on maximizing efficiency, consistency, and minimizing the subsequent human error factor of related tasks. Demonstrated experience with performing hardware and software system validation testing and validation of software and functional testing as it relates directly to Authorization and Accreditation of CDSs. Demonstrated experience with the ability to use troubleshooting, critical thinking, and analytical expertise and approaches to overcome networking, hardware, system, configuration, filtering, scripting, and setup issues to achieve successful implementation and integration results. Working knowledge of all aspects of enterprise-grade IT solutions across the technology stack: physical, networking, storage, virtualization, servers, applications, and services. Familiarity and/or hands-on experience with providing O&M support of Cisco Adaptive Security Appliances (ASAs) is a plus. Familiarity with enterprise Microsoft server-based applications, such as Exchange, IIS, SQL, SharePoint, etc. and/or services, such as Active Directory (AD) and Domain Naming Service (DNS) is a plus. Familiarity and/or hands-on experience with providing O&M support of Red Hat Satellite to centrally administer RHEL platforms is a plus. Familiarity and/or hands-on experience with providing O&M support to Security Enhanced Linux (SELinux) configurations are a plus. Familiarity with and/or experience using McAfee ePolicy Orchestrator, Management for Optimized Virtual Environments (MOVE), and VirusScan Enterprise for Storage (VSES) for the purpose of satisfying IA/INFOSEC end-point anti-virus, threat, firewall, and web control is a plus. Familiarity with and/or experience using the SolarWinds Orion Platform (NPM, NTA, NCM, IPAM, UDT, NTM, DPA, SAM, etc.) for the purpose of enterprise-wide centralized entity performance, configuration, capacity, and availability monitoring is a plus. Familiarity with and/or experiencing providing server and/or desktop O&M support within Virtual Desktop Infrastructure (VDI) implementations are desired. Specific experience working with Citrix XenDesktop hosted offerings is a plus. Familiarity with IT Networking technologies, concepts, and approaches to routing and switching, TCP/IP, traffic analysis, packet capturing and analysis, and traffic flow is a plus. Must be able to remain in a stationary position 50%. Needs to occasionally move about inside the office to access file cabinets, office machinery, etc. Constantly operates a computer and other office productivity machinery, such as a calculator, copy machine and computer printer. Often positions self to maintain computers in the lab, including under the desks and in the server closet. Frequently communicates with co-workers, management and customers, which may involve delivering presentations. Must be able to exchange accurate information in these situations. May be asked to move Audio/Visual or Computer equipment

title: Specialist Solutions Architect (FED...
content: Serve as a primary technical expert for hybrid cloud technologies within the Sales team Lead the gathering of architecture for and design and presentation of solutions to meet the needs of our prospective customers Conduct regular demonstrations of Red Hat OpenShift, Red Hat Ansible Automation Platform, and other Red Hat cloud suite technologies Guide and support presales pilots, demonstrations, workshops, proofs of concepts, evaluations, and benchmarks Provide timely and accurate technical responses to presales requests Actively engage and support prospective customers in technical evaluations of Red Hat's cloud suite offerings Develop and maintain tools to support the Sales and Marketing teams, including demonstrations and presentation materials Contribute to building best practices among peers in sales and engineering Ensure that revenue quota, deployment, and service objectives are met while maintaining a high level of satisfaction among existing and prospective customers Research and write the responses to technical sections of requests for information (RFIs) and requests for proposals (RFPs) Form relationships with technical customer associates to identify new opportunities Bachelor's degree in computer science, computer engineering, or equivalent experience 5+ years of experience working in a technical presale, support, or consulting role Knowledge of and operational experience with methodologies related to containers, Kubernetes, or DevOps Knowledge of enterprise cloud solutions and deploying and running solutions in a cloud environment and private, public, and hybrid clouds Solid Linux system administration skills at the Red Hat Certified System Administrator (RHCSA) level or higher; certifications are a plus Active TS/SCI with CI Poly Willingness to travel up to 25% Comprehensive medical, dental, and vision coverage Flexible Spending Account - healthcare and dependent care Health Savings Account - high deductible medical plan Retirement 401(k) with employer match Paid time off and holidays Paid parental leave plans for all new parents Leave benefits including disability, paid family medical leave, and paid military leave Additional benefits including employee stock purchase plan, family planning reimbursement, tuition reimbursement, transportation expense account, employee assistance program, and more!

title: System Administrator - Red Hat Ente...
content: The candidate should have demonstrated Red Hat experience as an engineer and administrator working at a client site in a high stress environment and deliver measurable results Experience designing and managing Red Hat systems in multi-datacenter environments, with HA and DR design experience Knowledge of Linux AdministrationProficient with BashProficient with Red Hat IDM and the commands required to automate actions within Active DirectoryProficient with Satellite and the commands required to automate actions within SatelliteProficient with Puppet and the commands required to automate actions within Satellite Manage all aspects of CI/CD the environment, including installation, upgrade, patching, and monitoring Must have good scripting experience in at least one of the scripting languages (bash, perl, python, ruby) Experience in DevOps team member to integrate CI/CD pipelines with OpenShift Provide technical leadership and technical guidance on projects Participate in internal workshops and provide presentations of the proposed solutions Hands on experience working with Openshift 3.x, 4.x - RBAC, AD/LDAP Integration, CI/CD, Secret Management, Image Scanning, Certificates, SSL/TSL Provide T3 level engineering support for Red Hat Enterprise Linux environment Assist in troubleshooting CI/CD related tasks in OpenShift & Jenkins Working knowledge of Nexus, Docker, Maven, Jenkins, SonarQube, Gitlab is a must Understand all elements of the software development life cycle, including planning, development, requirements management, Configuration Management, quality assurance, and release management The candidate must be able to deliver technical documentation and user documentation as required This position may require occasional off hours support to perform upgrades and patches Must be a team player Required Experience/Qualifications  Requires US Citizenship and an active SECRET Government Security Clearance Preferred Experience/Qualifications  Requires US Citizenship and an active SECRET Government Security Clearance Required: Extensive Knowledge and Experience in a Linux high level of Red Hat:  10+ years senior level RHEL engineering experience  6+ years with in depth RHEL troubleshooting skills, working with automation tools (Ansible, Puppet), Scripting experience with (PERL, Bash, Python, or Ruby) Understanding and working knowledge with databases (Oracle, MySQL, or PostgreSQL) Strong written and verbal communication skills Working knowledge of Linux internal components, and kick start. 10+ years required experience in Information Technology, hardware, software, development Optional/Preferred: vCenter, CEPH (Object storage), RH Satellite, VMWare vSphere, vRealize, Jenkins, Nexus Repository Manager, Special Requirements/Security Clearance Clearance required: SECRET * Optional/Preferred: vCenter, CEPH (Object storage), RH Satellite, VMWare vSphere, vRealize, Jenkins, Nexus Repository Manager, Maven, HAProxy, Apache Web Server, Gitlab, PostgreSQL, OpenShift. Certifications: Red Hat Certified Engineer, or Red Hat Certified Architect Education: BS/MS Information Technology; Computer Science  Experience designing and managing Red Hat systems in multi-datacenter environments, with HA and DR design experience  Knowledge of Linux Administration Proficient with Bash Proficient with Red Hat IDM and the commands required to automate actions within Active Directory Proficient with Satellite and the commands required to automate actions within Satellite Proficient with Puppet and the commands required to automate actions within Satellite  Manage all aspects of CI/CD the environment, including installation, upgrade, patching, and monitoring  Must have good scripting experience in at least one of the scripting languages (bash, perl, python, ruby)  Experience in DevOps team member to integrate CI/CD pipelines with OpenShift  Provide technical leadership and technical guidance on projects  Participate in internal workshops and provide presentations of the proposed solutions  Hands on experience working with Openshift 3.x, 4.x - RBAC, AD/LDAP Integration, CI/CD, Secret Management, Image Scanning, Certificates, SSL/TSL  Provide T3 level engineering support for Red Hat Enterprise Linux environment  Assist in troubleshooting CI/CD related tasks in OpenShift & Jenkins  Working knowledge of Nexus, Docker, Maven, Jenkins, SonarQube, Gitlab is a must  Understand all elements of the software development life cycle, including planning, development, requirements management, Configuration Management, quality assurance, and release management  The candidate must be able to deliver technical documentation and user documentation as required  This position may require occasional off hours support to perform upgrades and patches  Must be a team player Required Experience/Qualifications  Requires US Citizenship and an active SECRET Government Security Clearance Preferred Experience/Qualifications  Requires US Citizenship and an active SECRET Government Security Clearance Required: Extensive Knowledge and Experience in a Linux high level of Red Hat:  10+ years senior level RHEL engineering experience  6+ years with in depth RHEL troubleshooting skills, working with automation tools (Ansible, Puppet), Scripting experience with (PERL, Bash, Python, or Ruby) Understanding and working knowledge with databases (Oracle, MySQL, or PostgreSQL) Strong written and verbal communication skills Working knowledge of Linux internal components, and kick start. 10+ years required experience in Information Technology, hardware, software, development Optional/Preferred: vCenter, CEPH (Object storage), RH Satellite, VMWare vSphere, vRealize, Jenkins, Nexus Repository Manager, Special Requirements/Security Clearance Clearance required: SECRET * Optional/Preferred: vCenter, CEPH (Object storage), RH Satellite, VMWare vSphere, vRealize, Jenkins, Nexus Repository Manager, Maven, HAProxy, Apache Web Server, Gitlab, PostgreSQL, OpenShift. title: Federal - Cyber Threat Hunter
content: Tuning alerts and implementing threat detection analytics Deploy and maintain security sensors and tools Monitor & triage alerts generated from sensors Utilize scripting to automate tasks Review cyber threat intelligence feeds to convert intelligence into useful detections Identify incident root cause and develop proactive mitigation steps Create and brief customer reports Detect patterns/outliers within data sets that match TTPs of known threat actors, malware and otherwise unusual behaviors. Create dashboards within Splunk to clearly identify scope of findings Provide expert analytic investigative support of large scale and complex security incidents. Conduct dynamic and static malware analysis on samples obtained during incident handling or hunt operations in order to ide Experience in an offensive and/or defensive cyber operations role (eg., Red Team, Threat Hunting, Incident Response, SOC Analyst, Penetration Tester Experience with any open-source software (Kali Linux, Metasploit, Burp Suite, Nmap, etc.) Experience with automated tools (Phantom, Dimesto) Skill in interacting with various platform APIs to retrieve and manipulate data Understanding of MITRE ATT&CK and Lockheed Martin’s Killchain You have one or more of the following certifications: Networking (Cisco, Palo Alto, Juniper) Security Tools (Splunk, Carbon Black, Cylance, McAfee, Tenable, FireEye, CrowdStrike, ELK) SAN/GIAC (GCIH, GCIH, GREM, GCED, GCDA) US Citizenship Required

title: SLED Services Manager - Remote
content: Design and implement effective, high-impact technical and business solutions for Red Hat's customers with a focus on our emerging technologies Sell Red Hat's solutions using the business requirements of your customers to create unique Red Hat offerings  Grow your territory through the development of internal business partnerships with the Field Sales team as well as alliance and partner programs Accurately and consistently provide revenue and booking forecasts for your territory Ensure successful delivery of all projects maintaining a high customer satisfaction level Coordinate customer managers who manage consultants, fostering a culture of collaboration within your team Position and manage complex, multi-product solutions using Red Hat’s Open Transformation Framework  Grow your sales and revenue on an annual basis Manage customer escalations without supervision Assist with negotiating statements of work with the customers and legal teams Knowledge of technical or business consulting practices Project delivery and technical implementation experience Experience with internal or external field sales Ability to architect complex solutions using multiple offerings and technologies  Solid people management skills Experience adhering to open framework methodologies within project teams Knowledge of application development or cloud solutions creation and delivery Experience and willingness to speak at public conferences and meetups Experience in customer-facing positions as a professional services consultant or engineer, preferably within a technology or consulting organization Comprehensive medical, dental, and vision coverage Flexible Spending Account - healthcare and dependent care Health Savings Account - high deductible medical plan Retirement 401(k) with employer match Paid time off and holidays Paid parental leave plans for all new parents Leave benefits including disability, paid family medical leave, and paid military leave Additional benefits including employee stock purchase plan, family planning reimbursement, tuition reimbursement, transportation expense account, employee assistance program, and more!

title: Senior Product Security Engineer - ...
content: Providing technical direction for our new static and analysis pipelines Developing custom static analysis tools using Ruby and Go Performing root cause analysis of vulnerabilities and developing new static analysis rules Developing custom CodeQL and Semgrep queries for internal projects Developing tools to track vulnerabilities from discovery to remediation by engineering teams Being an internal advocate for static analysis and other security tools 5+ years of professional experience in developing software Strong written and verbal communication skills Comfort collaborating with other security teams and engineers in an asynchronous environment Familiarity with security vulnerabilities specific to Ruby on Rails, Go, or JavaScript Practical software development skills using Ruby or Go Solid understanding of testing principles and high quality software Experience providing leadership on existing and new projects Experience providing technical mentorship to other team members Experience using static analysis tools such as CodeQL, Semgrep and Brakeman Experience of cloud infrastructure such as Kubernetes, AWS or Azure Experience with dynamic web testing tools Experience using Git and GitHub

title: Senior Solution Architect - Remote
content: Gain an in-depth understanding of customer business and IT environments and collaborate with sales teams to assess the potential application of Red Hat’s solutions Provide presales technical support for the development and implementation of complex solutions Use your technical expertise to deliver presentations and demonstrations Coordinate the technical efforts of other Red Hat’s associates like solutions, support, and professional services specialists Deliver compelling recommendations that will result in the closing of new sales 5+ years of experience working in sales engineering, consulting, IT architecture, or equivalent supporting strategic accounts Excellent communication and presentation skills; record of developing relationships at engineering, program management, and executive levels Experience working with modern development practices like DevOps or continuous integration (CI) Knowledge of and experience working with development and deployment on JEE application servers like Red Hat JBoss Enterprise Application Platform (JBoss EAP), Oracle WebLogic, or IBM WebSphere Knowledge of and experience with enterprise solutions and architectures like cloud, applications, management, big data, virtualization, storage, RDBMS, enterprise resource planning (ERP) tools like Oracle or SAP, clustering, and high availability Red Hat Certified System Administrator (RHCSA), Red Hat Certified Engineer (RHCE), VMware Certified Professional (VCP), or Information Technology Infrastructure Library (ITIL) certification Willingness to travel up to 50%, following Red Hat’s COVID-19 guidelines Comprehensive medical, dental, and vision coverage Flexible Spending Account - healthcare and dependent care Health Savings Account - high deductible medical plan Retirement 401(k) with employer match Paid time off and holidays Paid parental leave plans for all new parents Leave benefits including disability, paid family medical leave, and paid military leave Additional benefits including employee stock purchase plan, family planning reimbursement, tuition reimbursement, transportation expense account, employee assistance program, and more!

title: Experienced Phlebotomist (CSI)
content: Comply with applicable Federal, State and local regulations as well as all American Red Cross policies, procedures and guidelines.  May perform any or all blood collection procedures (may include allogeneic, autologous, directed, therapeutic; automated red cell and platelet pheresis) donor collections. May perform all types of donor health history screening and eligibility procedures.  Conduct donor greeting, donor reaction care and processing and packing of blood as assigned.  Perform daily function checks, assemble and maintain supplies and equipment to ensure a state of readiness and to maintain compliance.  Function with team effort to ensure efficient donation process focused on donor and sponsor expectations. Maintain positive public relations to promote a professional image.  May operate ARC vehicle. May transport supplies and equipment in a state of readiness and to ensure compliance. May operate assigned vehicle according to applicable regulations. Collections Staff that is hired with DOT driving responsibilities will perform vehicle checks and complete DOT paperwork per established protocol.  Load, set up, maintain and tear down supplies and equipment in a state of readiness and to ensure compliance.  Complete required readings and training assignments by assigned deadline.  Perform other related duties as necessary.

title: Proposal Manager – Critical Infrast...
content: Perform detailed analysis of RFP/RFQ/RFI documents to assess requirements and develop compelling proposal narratives that demonstrate our value proposition Facilitate proposal storyboarding sessions, strategic messaging, and creative writing for all levels of pursuits Facilitate proposal kick-off meeting and color reviews (pink, red, gold) to ensure we produce quality deliverables that differentiate us from our competitors and provide value to our clients Collaborate with our graphics team to establish templates and standards for proposal look and feel, writing style, and layout Responsible for writing non-technical portions of the proposal (i.e., cover letters, executive summaries, project descriptions, resumes, team qualifications, various management plans, win themes and discriminators, etc.) Review all proposal drafts and final documents to ensure responsiveness, thoroughness, accuracy and quality Provide oversight and guidance on graphics development Establish a production schedule and resource plan to ensure all required proposal documents are produced properly and delivered on time Oversee client interview preparation, development of collateral and coaching activities Contribute and maintain SalesCloud Opportunity CRM record for accuracy and completeness Perform closeout activities ensuring lessons learned and debriefing process is initiated Strong facilitation, leadership, and communication skills to lead capture teams through the pursuit lifecycle Excellent written, interpersonal, and communication skills (ability to write executive summaries, cover letters and other non-technical sections) Able to inspire outstanding work from team members with a range of experience and technical abilities in the development of proposal documents Capable to adapting to changing priorities in a very dynamic work environment and demonstrate the ability to work in stressful situations with critical deadlines (evening and weekend work may be required to meet deadlines) Required to work on multiple assignments, with overlapping schedules, and needs to be able to multi-task and delegate responsibilities to team members to accomplish all tasks Ensure alignment with corporate strategy, business line strategic goals, promote technologies/innovation, build meaningful relationships, and align with business markets Proficient in utilizing Adobe Creative Suite (Adobe In-Design, Illustrator, and Acrobat Pro) Proficient in Microsoft Office Suite software (Word, Excel, and PowerPoint) Four-year degree in Marketing, English, Business, Communications, Liberal Arts, or a related field required  Minimum seven years of progressive proposal management experience  AEC industry experience is highly preferred, particularly in the preparation and management of large program management proposals ($500M+) and/or proposals involving alternate project delivery (design-build/public private partnerships)

title: Sales Executive (Remote)
content: Analyze opportunities by researching the industry and market trends in US/Canada  Identify business opportunities with new prospective clients (i.e. not account management) Prepare leads lists and cold call prospects Handle incoming requests for demos of the tool Give virtual demos of our SaaS to prospective clients Occasionally visit local properties to demonstrate our SaaS Prepare reports by collecting sales information and statistics Hotel or Hostel Operations Management experience A true passion for sales Excitement for new technology and a strong technical aptitude Great phone presence, the ability to engage and excite potential customers Positive and outgoing attitude Time management skills Organization skills The ability and the will to challenge the status quo Bonus: Multilingual Fastest Growing Companies | Inc. 500 (2018 & 2019)  Best Places to Work | Inc Magazine (2017 & 2018) Best Places to Work | HotelTechReport (2018, 2019, 2020, 2021) Start-Ups to Watch | Forbes (2018) Best Startup Employers | Forbes (2020) Technology Fast 500 | Deloitte (2020) Top 100 North America | Red Herring (2020)

title: Cyber Security Associate 3 (Vulnera...
content: Assist in the further development and continued operation of an existing enhanced vulnerability management program The reporting will be risk based and consider various metrics used to determine the urgency and criticality of a vulnerability Use available data to identify trends and patterns that indicate where significant risks lie in the infrastructure Develop reporting and indicators on the latest significant vulnerabilities and risks and impact; and disseminate info as appropriate to affected parties This is not a simple repeating of open source data, the candidate will merge the vulnerability/threat data with an analysis of assets and shall alert system owners, ISOs, and government leadership to indicators that need attention Reporting will be point in time, time series, tabular, graphic, and other formats necessary to convey the severity and urgency of vulnerabilities The candidate may be required to do basic macro and script programming to transform the raw data into meaningful reporting  Perform daily vulnerability management awareness activities   Monitor software vendor websites, DHS-CISA, US-CERT, exploit-db   com, and other established cybersecurity threat announcement sites for indications of new vulnerabilities that affect known system configuration   Utilizing the Nessus Vulnerability Scan reports and identifying systems with Nessus Vulnerability Priority Rating scores that warrant notifications to the system owners   The list of sites monitored is dynamic and changes based on organizational need   Research for vulnerabilities in hardware, software, and systems   Provide a daily summary of all new vulnerabilities that affect known systems with   Create a daily vulnerability report will summarize any newly discovered critical/zero-day vulnerabilities affecting judicial systems from the previous 24-hour (or weekend) period   Design and implement the above described solution  Bachelor's with 5 - 8 years (or commensurate experience) Has experience developing and supporting a vulnerability management system Able to use automated and manual techniques to identify potential security flaws in applications and systems that cyber attackers could exploit Can run scans, eg , with Nessus, to conduct vulnerability assessments for networks, applications, and operating systems Capable of fine-tuning test tools to reduce false positives and negatives Ability to compile and track vulnerabilities over time for metrics purposes, write vulnerability assessment reviews, and maintain a vulnerability assessment database Proficient with Splunk and Tenable, including Splunk Searching Processing Language SPL One or more industry-recognized cybersecurity certification preferred, (e.g. Certified Information Systems Security Professional (CISSP), Certification Information System Auditor (CISA), Certified Ethical Hacker (CEH), Certification Authorization Professional (CAP), Offensive Security Certified Professional (OSCP), or Security +)

title: Lead Cyber Security Engineer
content: Organize and coordinate Surface Combatant Information Assurance Accreditation . This includes coordinating with Shipbuilders, PARMs, NAVSEA CIO and other stakeholders to accredit and maintain the accreditation of the networks.   Advises team to challenging technical issues, coordinates the use of technical resources across the organization on multi-disciplinary problems, and provides technical guidance and leadership to less-experienced engineers and other technical staff. Works within a peer group of senior technical staff to periodically review technical plans, results, and work products.   Performs complex and advanced engineering work in design, evaluation, planning, testing and accreditation in support of network architecture development and implementation.   Prepares and provides formal briefings to the staff and project sponsors. Leads cybersecurity discussions at program review sessions   Supports program risk identification and management activities. Coordinates the application of the technical resources when required.   Building on experience and research on new technologies and processes provide advice and recommendations to team on meeting challenges of new shipbuilding programs.   Develops documentation, reports, and project plans and prepares and may present briefings and staff seminars.   Performs additional duties and responsibilities as assigned.   Bachelor’s degree in Information Technology, Information Assurance, Cybersecurity or equivalent is required.   10 years’ experience in IA or cybersecurity accreditation.   Familiarity with DoD IA accreditation.   A U.S. DoD Active Secret Security Clearance is required.   Preferred Master’s Degree, CISM, or CISSP.

title: Lead Cybersecurity Analyst
content: The Lead Cybersecurity Analyst will assist the PM with management of the Cybersecurity Watch Division, including direction, administration, quality assurance, and leadership of the execution of the contract team and their work.  The Lead Cybersecurity Analyst will develop written intelligence products and brief counterparts and senior officials. Therefore, experience is required working jointly with IC departments and agencies. Knowledge of applicable policies and instructions is required, such as the NIST 800 series and DoD Instructions, which are relatable to this program. This work may also entail occasional support of headquarters-related activities, such as assisting with proposal writing. Required Certifications: IAT II required; CSSP desirable. Years of Experience: Minimum of Ten (10) years’ experience. Degree Requirement: Master’s Degree. Minimum Clearance Requirement: Top Secret with SCI. U.S. Citizenship: Required.

title: Lead Cybersecurity Engineer
content: Required Certifications: IAT II and CSSP required. Years of Experience: Minimum of Ten (10) years’ experience. Degree Requirement: Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science or related field desired, although experience may be considered in lieu of degree. Minimum Clearance Requirement: Top Secret with SCI. U.S. Citizenship: Required.

title: Manager, Training and Doctrine SAF/...
content: Lead and manage a team responsible for a diverse portfolio of training and doctrine needs for ISD and SAF, to include the development and execution of a department-wide coordinated approach to doctrine creation, development, inventory, and a corresponding training process that is clear, simple, and adhered to. In consultation and coordination with key stakeholders, evaluate the effectiveness of current learning programs, to identify and assess appropriate learning solutions based on business needs. Oversee the execution of learning solutions to meet a variety of organizational and programmatic training and development needs, to include departmental onboarding for ISD and SAF. Understand & leverage the corporate Learning Management System (LMS) to curate professional development opportunities based on required competencies for key positions. Recruit and oversee a cadre of training & doctrine volunteers to help coordinate, plan, and execute learning solutions. Supervise a team of paid employees and volunteers to meet the training and doctrine needs of the ISD/SAF departments. Develop the plan and budget for in-person and virtual instructor-led training, to include outlining needs for logistical support from a range of stakeholders to include the administrative support team, consultants, and/or internal clients. Has accountability for the ISD and SAF training & development needs assessment process to include evaluation of requests, coordination with appropriate key stakeholders, solution design, and determining resource capacity. Serves as a subject matter expert in all phases of learning design and delivery of ISD and SAF training and development programs, providing mentorship and guidance to team members, volunteers, and other stakeholders. Manages and directs project management activities for training and doctrine portfolio. Minimum 7-10 years of related experience in Training, Instructional Design, Facilitation, Curriculum Development, Human Resources Development, or relevant field or equivalent combination of education and related experience required. A minimum of 5-7 years supervisory experience required; with volunteer management experience strongly preferred. Bachelor's Degree in HR Development, Training, Instructional Design, or equivalent work experience is required. Hands-on experience in training design, development, and delivery; to include team and leadership development programs is required. Demonstrates excellent presentation, platform, speaking, writing, and facilitation skills. Experience with Microsoft Office Suite to include Teams and SharePoint. Must possess strong personal integrity and an ability to adapt to and manage changing situations in a highly matrixed and ambiguous environment. Demonstrated experience providing high quality customer service to clients, colleagues, and stakeholders with an ability to influence without authority and ensure the training team delivers high quality service delivery.  Strong diplomatic and interpersonal skills, the ability to work with multiple priorities, juggle competing demands, and demonstrate the ability to effectively manage a variety of portfolios from stakeholders.   Familiarity with international disaster response and military culture regulations and protocol are desired, as is the knowledge of Red Cross programs, policies, procedures, and systems.  Project Management experience strongly preferred.

title: Security Assurance Engineer
content: General security analysis  Design work (product architecture)  Physical security testing  System-level logical analysis  Cryptographic and Public Key Infrastructure (PKI) testing  Cryptographic algorithm testing  Source code review activities  Test case development/execution  Technical report writing and review  Testing automation through scripting  Senior Security Assurance Engineer hires will have additional opportunities to lead projects which would entail serving as the main POC with commercial vendors and government oversight  Requires Bachelor's degree or 4 years equivalent experience in technical discipline (Electrical Engineering, Computer Engineering, Computer Science, Mathematics or related discipline).  Knowledge of FIPS 140-2 requirements  Knowledge of cryptographic encryption algorithms, key exchange algorithms, hashing/message authentication algorithms, PKI, random number generators, etc.  Experience with various programming languages (C, C++, Python or Java) and development environments  Ability to comprehend security standard requirements and apply them to products  Knowledge of common security related protocols and their design (i.e. SSH, IPsec, TLS, etc.)  Experience building testing environments, performing testing and reporting results (technical writing)  Strong problem solving skills  Strong multitasking and time management

title: Senior Contracts Manager
content: The candidate should have progressive experience providing cradle-to-grave contract administration support for various CP, FFP, T&M Government contracts including RFP analysis, hands-on proposal development including the development of terms and conditions, coordination of appropriate internal reviews, contract negotiation, and contract/task order administration and execution. Candidate will be responsible for overall contract compliance of assigned tasks in accordance with contract requirements, company policy and procedures, and applicable laws. Candidate must be able to work independently as well as part of a team of contract professionals supporting proposal preparation and a portfolio of contracts. Candidate must be able to multi-task and prioritize work activities in a fast paced environment and effectively communicate at all levels within the organization. The candidate will frequently interact - written, oral, and face-to-face - with other contracts and procurement staff, functional peers, Program management and external and internal customers. Ability to lead the review and analysis of RFP's, prepare compliant and cost/price proposals, and represent Leidos’s interests during negotiations and contract administration.  Scope of work includes Red Team reviews, review and negotiate Teaming Agreements, NDAs and licenses as required. General experience in Contract Administration may be considered in lieu of degree. Experience with Government (FAR / DFAR) contracting: Fixed Price (FP), Time & Material (T&M), Cost Plus Award Fee (CPAF), Cost Plus Fixed Fee (CPFF), Level of Effort (LOE), Indefinite Delivery / Indefinite Quantity (IDIQ) and General Service Administration (GSA) type contracts. Must have the ability to make sound business judgments, handle multiple contractual activities with a short turn-around time, and work independently as well as part of a Team. The Candidate must be proficient with Microsoft Office Suite, especially Excel, Word, and Outlook. The Candidate must have excellent interpersonal skills to include well developed analytical, communication, and presentation skills. Ability to identify and mitigate contract risks as well as coordinate appropriate reviews in accordance with Leidos policy and procedures. Local travel may be required. Must have a Top Secret/SCI Clearance and be willing to obtain a polygraph.

title: Senior Proposal Manager
content: Responsible for RFP/RFI analysis; leads the development, production, and delivery of proposals and proposal-related products Executes the MTSI proposal development process across the proposal lifecycle Responsible for proposal schedules, plans, outlines, templates, and mockups; works with the Director of Proposals and capture manager to assign proposal resources (writers, SMEs, reviewers) as required Responsible for end-to-end ownership and command of proposal development and related support processes, including desktop publishing and graphics development Facilitates proposal solution-development working sessions to formulate and integrate proposal strengths, discriminators, and strategies with a compliant and efficient structure Leads regular proposal team status meetings Leads or coordinates all proposal color team reviews; develops review packages and consolidates feedback Collaborates with all MTSI infrastructure teams including contracts, subcontracts, finance, quality, security, and human resources as needed to ensure all RFP requirements are addressed Responsible for providing input and accessibility to proposal resources including past performance, resumes, prior proposal database, and other boilerplate information including: corporate overview, core competencies, program management plan, contract/sub-contract management plan, quality assurance plan, retention plan, etc. Responsible for ensuring that proposal reads as “one voice” and tells a compelling, substantiated story. Ensures that the proposal is free of grammar, spelling, and typographical errors  Confirms through appropriate compliance reviews that proposal complies with all RFP requirement and all proposal production requirements for hardcopy and electronic delivery, as required Manages timeline so that all components of the proposal are submitted well in advance of proposal deadline Is able to work independently, proactively identify and complete tasks, and serve as a backup to the Director of Proposals as needed Maintains the flexibility to work extended hours as needed. Extensive experience in proposal development across all process elements and volumes (i.e., technical, past performance, management, cost volumes; blue, pink, red, and gold team reviews; white glove and production);  Expert-level experience in proposal management and who has been in the profession for 17+ years; has managed medium-large, high-priority proposals. Post-graduate degree and 17+ years relevant business experience, or a graduate degree and 20+ years of experience, or undergraduate degree and 25+ years relevant proposal experience required. Completion of certifications required, as appropriate for position, such as APMP.

title: Software Security Presales Engineer...
content: Help in building foundation practices that can help in delivering Pre-sales efforts to customers Work with team to integrate identity solutions into the overall message Delivers compelling technical and industry thought leadership to persuade One Identity’s customers’ business and technical decision makers of the superior business value and technical capabilities of One Identity products and our long-term vision and strategy Obtain thorough grasp of customers’ business and technical issues in order to architect a compelling solution and clearly articulate how One Identity solves the customer’s specific challenges These engagements include technology presentations, customized product demonstrations, Proof of Concept exercises and concise architectural/solution documentation Travel to assist local One Identity account teams and One Identity partners in closing license deals in competitive sales situations and service strategic customers as they implement and maintain One Identity products Work effectively within customer organizations by building stronger enterprise relationships from C level to the technical level personnel. Maintains and regularly exercises expert level certification in applicable One Identity solutions as directed by management Provide expertise and forward-thinking strategies to key One Identity teams including other solution architects, sales, systems consulting, product management, professional services, support and relevant business units Oversee customer projects, directing the work of consultants and communicating with the customer and the One Identity services team in a clear and timely fashion, thereby ensuring successful implementation. Maintain skills in IGA, PAM, and Active Directory. 10+ years of overall related experience or combination of education and experience 3+ Years’ experience with Identity Solutions 3+Years of experience working as either a Solution Architect or Systems Consulting (presales) role Architect level Enterprise Identity Management experience with emphasis on Role Based Access Control Travel Requirements of 40%  Must be a maximum 1 hour commute from a major airport Extensive experience in Identity Management Successfully delivering complex POCs or Pilots Understanding and designing solutions for heterogeneous environments and systems are essential Hands-on project experience mapping business requirements to business logic, designing and implementing custom identity workflows, resource provisioning, and role based access controls Expertise in access control list (ACL), Segregation of Duties (SoD), users, dynamic groups and roles planning and implementing Familiarity with Governance and Compliance issues and solutions as it relates to Identity Management Familiarity with Privilege Access Management Solutions A key indicator of this experience would be a skill set that includes one or more of the following product suites: Sailpoint, Saviynt, Cyberark, Centrify, Thycotic, IBM/Tivoli Identity Management, Oracle Identity Management (or Oblix/COREid/Thor), Computer Associates Identity Management (or Netegrity), MIIS (Microsoft Identity Integration Server or MMS (Microsoft Management Server) or Zoomit), SunOne, Identity Management, Oracle Identity Manager, Novell Identity Manager, BMC Identity Management (or Passlogix),Waveset, Varonis or similar Governance suites  Experience in competing Identity Management, Privilege Management solutions  Life at One Identity means collaborating with dedicated professionals with a passion for technology.  When we see something that could be improved, we get to work inventing the solution.  Our people demonstrate our winning culture through positive and meaningful relationships.  We invest in our people and offer a series of programs that enables them to pursue a career that fulfills their potential.  Our team members’ health and wellness is our priority as well as rewarding them for their hard work.

title: Systems Engineer
content: Contributing to architectural vision and customer-driven objectives on adoption of next generation terrestrial, cellular, wireless, and satellite waveforms/propagation and their interactions, including for example DVB-S2X Performing systems engineering and architecture development using new and emerging technologies Facilitating collaboration with the platform team and other engineering functions on system design issues Maintaining a high level of awareness of competitive developments, technology trends, and of complimentary third party technologies Build, mentor and maintain a strong/collaborative team that interfaces properly through the Government organization. Communicate and enforce Government engineering process. Identify opportunities for improvement and make constructive suggestions for change. Working with development engineers to define internal and external software interfaces/protocols that perform the desired functionality, while ensuring optimal efficiency and robustness. Working with product line management and internally in the systems architecture group to refine and understand product requirements. Creation and maintenance of interface control documents and technical specifications. Acting as a subject matter expert to answer developer questions pertaining to interfaces. Partner with engineering team leaders (Program Management, Hardware, Software, Quality) to scope and manage overall Product Line architecture, development, risk management, change control, resource management and resource conflicts that impact delivery success. Maintain high level of awareness of complimentary 3rd party technologies. Experience in architecting or designing and testing systems/fixtures in a multi-disciplinary environment including developing and writing software for test and integration, e.g. C/C++/C#, LabView, Python, etc Satellite Communication experience with DVB-S2, TDMA, SCPC a plus Ability to lead technical discussions for new features, drive consensus, and capture the results in writing in the form of designs, models, and requirements Knowledge of networking systems (cellular, telecom, satellite, etc.) Hands on testing and troubleshooting experience a plus. Hands-on experience with VSAT network products is a plus. Knowledge of networking protocols (TCP/IP, UDP, Ethernet, DHCP, VoIP, ARP, QinQ, etc.) Excellent written and verbal communication skills on technical matters 5+ years of related SW and/or HW development experience Must be able to work in a fast paced development environment. Must be able to analyze and solve technical problems. Must be able to document existing software. Demonstrated leadership and communications skills Must be able to complete tasks in a timely manner. Must be able to communicate (oral/written) effectively. Must be able to work under pressure. Self-motivated, independent worker The ability to learn quickly, evaluate ideas, and propose technical solutions Ability to write technical specifications reports, business correspondence, and procedure manuals. Interpersonal Skills: The ability to actively pursue technical solutions by consensus between different technical groups. The ability to run productive meetings on technical topics is also required.

title: US Government Bid Manager
content: As Bid Manager the incumbent will assume the following roles: A leader forming relationships with the bid team A facilitator of the proposal strategy and storyboarding A manager overseeing proposal production Articulate documentation to sound like one coherent voice Understand customer character and requirements, reflecting this in the final proposal Coach subject matter expert authors in support of writing winning bids Format, edit and collate a coherent bid Lead the Pink and Red Team reviews Lead the lessons learned and implement/recommend changes in the process. Minimum of 8-10 years of experience in proposal writing and bid management Superior oral and written communication and interpersonal skills Ability to multitask in a fast-paced environment Flexibility to travel both domestically and internationally on a regular basis Previous experience in Government Contracts Bachelor’s degree Knowledge of the aerospace is preferred Additional working hours/overtime as required Regular travel (domestic/international) Current Secret or Secret eligible

title: 1st Information Operations Command ...
content: Certification: Certified at either the DoD 8570 Information Assurance Technician (IAT) Level III, or Information Assurance Manager (IAM) Level III. Master's Degree in Business Managment or Technical Field 12 years demonstrated experience in ONEof the following: Supporting Red Team capability in executing effects based cyberspace ops ISO Army and Joint exercises Vulnerability assessments; & establishing & maintaining PCO ISO persistent penetration testing (PPT) Cyber-Campaigns Supporting the Mission Assurance capability in conducting cyber-to-physical (control systems) assessments (perferably ISO NDAA 1650); integrating mission assurance capabilites ISO operational technologies and infrastructure assessments; assisting with certifying Army PENTESTING programs; and providing doctrine and policy development (preferably wtih OPSEC experience), and support DA G34 protection assessment Supporting the Cyber-Support Detachment with developing and maintaining remote operation capabilities; building and maintaining attack platforms; and tools/expolit development   Supporting Red Team capability in executing effects based cyberspace ops ISO Army and Joint exercises Vulnerability assessments; & establishing & maintaining PCO ISO persistent penetration testing (PPT) Cyber-Campaigns Supporting the Mission Assurance capability in conducting cyber-to-physical (control systems) assessments (perferably ISO NDAA 1650); integrating mission assurance capabilites ISO operational technologies and infrastructure assessments; assisting with certifying Army PENTESTING programs; and providing doctrine and policy development (preferably wtih OPSEC experience), and support DA G34 protection assessment Supporting the Cyber-Support Detachment with developing and maintaining remote operation capabilities; building and maintaining attack platforms; and tools/expolit development TS/SCI Clearance required with ability to obtain CI Polygraph

title: Cyber Security Architect with Secur...
content: Clearance:ActiveTS/SCI w/ Polygraph needed to applyCompany Overview: Cornerstone Defense, in partnership with our military, intelligence, and civil government customers, supports U.S. operations worldwide through the use of many different types of intelligence, satellite, and cyber technologies. Cornerstone's Intelligence Sector provides solutions to the United States Government for information collection, operations, exploitation and dissemination, and research activities. Our Team specializes in software development, cloud architecture, systems and network engineering, systems integration, agile management, as well as targeting operations and intelligence analysis. Our support to our mission customers includes cyber network operations, exploitation and defense, signals intelligence, human intelligence, and critical missions and networks. As a Chief Cyber Security Engineer/Architect directly supporting the customer, you will be trusted to provide both critical technical support in addressing complicated IT-related issues and delivering exceptional customer service. In this role the Security Engineer will work on the creation and maintenance of security relevant documentation (Security Plans, briefings, revisions, and updates, etc) act as an adviser to IT systems engineers, and propose changes to the enterprise technical architecture based on analysis of security requirements and new technology. The candidate will be responsible for providing expert level guidance to projects team members to ensure systems under development are compatible with existing enterprise IT Solutions and adhere to complex security requirements.Working as part of a motivated, high-performing teamResolving critical IT-related issues that negatively impact the customer's missionCollaborating with teammates and government customers to identify process improvementsLending expertise and institutional knowledge to less experienced engineers to improve the overall technical excellence of the team Required Qualifications:Education: Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related technical discipline, or the equivalent combination of education, technical certifications or training, or work experience.Minimum of 11 years related experience.Demonstrated experience evaluating security risk of applications, systems, and networks.Demonstrated experience developing, writing and maintaining Security plans for complex applications.Demonstrated experience engineering security solutions for large complex IT development effort involving both software and hardware.Demonstrated experience and knowledge of data protection levels and encryption standards.Demonstrated experience navigating through the customer security A&A process. Preferred Qualifications:Demonstrated experience working with security testing tools and mechanisms.Demonstrated experience engineering and securing cloud base solutionsDemonstrated experience with engineering security solution for service oriented architecture (SOA) and multi - tier systemsDemonstrated experience with the customer information security process and polices. title: Cyber Security Systems Engineer
content: CISSP - Certified Information System Security Professional; CEH - Certified Ethical Hacker; AWS A Supportive and Equitable Working Environment that is both Stimulating and Challenging Competitive Hourly Salary Unique Employee Success Sharing Program that allows ATP employees to Share in Company's Successes Automatic Approved Overtime (as long as contract permits) Retirement Pay (401K); 100% company paid, immediately vested with Profit-Sharing Component Company Medical Coverage Plans - HMO, Open Access, PPO plans Company Dental Plan - widely accepted, comprehensive, and flexible Progressive Overtime Policy Flexible Spending Account benefit Lucrative Referral Bonus Policy Holiday Scheduling that Coincides with Government Holidays Robust Professional Expenses & Training Program Computer Allowance Internet Allowance Short and Long Term Disability Life Insurance

title: Cybersecurity Engineer with Securit...
content: The Cybersecurity Engineer determines enterprise information assurance and security standards.Develops and implements information assurance/security standards and procedures for the customer.Coordinates, develops, and evaluates security programs for an organization.They will provide recommendations for information assurance/security solutions to support the customers' requirements.Identifies, reports, and resolves security violations.Establishes and satisfies information assurance and security requirements based upon the analysis of user, policy, regulatory, and resource demands.Defines, plans, designs, and evaluates information security system.Assesses architecture and current hardware limitations, defines and designs system specifications, input/output processes and working parameters for hardware/software compatibility.Support information system life cycle activities from rapidly establishing systems to support classified proposals, to scoping systems for new programs and preparing Risk Management Framework packages, to regular maintenance, support and upgrades of systems during program execution, to program close-out and de-certification activities.Ensure compliance with data security policies and relevant legal and regulatory requirements.Provide subject matter expertise in all cyber security initiatives and help in explaining new guidance.Ensure appropriate changes and improvement actions are implemented as required.Maintain current knowledge of authenticator management for unclassified systems Key Skills & Experience:Four (4) to Six (6) years of experience in enterprise information assurance and DOD security standards. Three (3) years of technical experience in support of Cybersecurity/network protection projects.Understanding of content filtering, application firewalls, malware detection, and networking capabilities and the ability to articulate TCP/IP protocols operations to include but not limited to domain name system (DNS), timing protocols, and secure communication protocols (e.g. SSH, SSL)Experience with Defense Health Agency desired Qualifications:BS degree in Network Security, or Computer Science.High level understanding of operating system security settings, configuration, and policies (Windows, Red Hat and/or other Linux) virtual environments, and/or scripting languages (Python, PowerShell, Bash, etc.)Familiarity with Risk Management Framework4-6 years of experience in the Cyber Security/ISSO fieldExcellent written and communication skillsAbility to write procedures and other informative correspondenceAbility to read, analyze and interpret security regulationsGood analytical and problem solving skills to troubleshoot and resolve network/operating system security issuesMinimum of DoD 8570.01-M IAT Level II is requiredCISSP Excentium offers a competitive salary and comprehensive benefits package, including medical, dental, life, disability, 401k, and paid time off. We take pride in building a workforce with a strong Veterans focus Excentium, Inc. is an equal opportunity employer. title: EDW Engineer with Security Clearanc...
content: Education/Experience: Bachelors (+8 yrs), Masters (+6 yrs) or PhD (+4 yrs) of relevant experience.  Agile experience at both the team and multiple-team level required. Strong organizational and interpersonal skills to communicate effectively with all levels of management and individual contributors. Experience administering Operating Systems (Linux – RedHat, Windows Sever 2012 or higher) Experience with AWS Cloud infrastructure and native automation toolsets. Experience with scripting (Bash, Python, Perl, etc.) Be responsible for installation, configuration and maintenance of servers and commercial software packages Perform software installations, maintain system documentation, manage server and software configurations, establish and enforce procedures, monitory system health, collect performance and participate in capacity planning. Ability to comprehend and analyze complex problems and develop solutions. Strong verbal and written communication skills Strong communication, team building and facilitation skills; demonstrated ability to communicate effectively with team, upper management and customers Knowledge of Project Management principles and experience utilizing them professionally Proven success managing multiple, large and multifaceted projects simultaneously Must have a DoD TS/SCI (within last six years) eligibility with poly. Preferred Qualifications: Ability to effectively interface with all levels of employees and government leadership Strong team building and interpersonal skills. title: Exercise Planning Specialist with S...
content: The contractor shall participate, coordinate, and provide exercise development input and support.  The contractor shall maintain subject matter expertise in IC exercise planning and execution to maintain continuity with current exercise planning and execution.  The contractor shall engage with the National Level Exercise (NLE) community, representing the equities of the IC SCC and CND community.  The contractor shall furnish all Action Reports tied to the IC SCC led exercises and annotate all findings, providing a course of actions of remediation where applicable.  The contractor shall provide a technical environment testbed for the purpose of testing emerging capabilities, tools, and processes.  The contractor shall integrate red/blue team IC partner capabilities and functions into annual training and scenario-based activities to meet exercise objectives.

title: Group Fitness Instructor- Yoga Inst...
content: Provide instructional group exercise classes. Have the ability to provide exercise sessions, 55 to 60 minutes in duration.Must have experience providing instruction at the following levels, but not limited to, beginner, intermediate and advanced with low impact/high intensity floor aerobics, Zumba, indoor cycling, Pilates, and Yoga.Explain and enforce safety rules and regulations governing sports, recreational activities, and the use of exercise equipment.Administer emergency first aid, wrap injuries, treat minor chronic disabilities, or refer injured persons to physicians. title: INFORMATION SECURITY ENGINEER with ...
company: T and T Consulting Services, Inc.
content: Perform periodic and on-demand system audits and vulnerability assessments including user accounts, application access, file system, and external web integrity scans to determine compliance  Ensure Subscriber HBSS Remote Consoles are properly managed and configured per the HBSS Security Technical Implementation Guide (STIG) Checklists 8. Prepare and submit Plan of Action and Milestones (POA&M) documents  Assist in development and maintenance of system Certification and Accreditation (C&A) documentation  CompTIA Security + or an equivalent DoD 8570 IAT II baseline certification Skills and Qualification Requirements: 3+ Years of DoD Host Based Security System (HBSS) Administration experience Equal Opportunity Employer/Veterans/Disabled

title: Information Security Analyst Adviso...
content: Install, configure, and maintain the Assured Compliance Assessment Solution (ACAS) framework and associated product suites.Assist with major version upgrades of Assured Compliance Assessment Solution (ACAS) servers and clients.Ensures the integrity and protection of networks, systems, and applications by technical enforcement of organizational security policies, through monitoring of vulnerability scanning devices.Performs periodic and on-demand system audits and vulnerability assessments, including user accounts, application access, file system and external Web integrity scans to determine compliance.Communicates alerts to agencies regarding intrusions and compromises to their network infrastructure, applications and operating systems.Work with security engineering team to integrate new capabilities, plan lifecycle replacements, and provide input into the security architecture roadmaps.Maintain system documentation.Prepares incident reports of analysis methodology and results. Standard CharacteristicsIdentify and manage network and system vulnerabilities and security eventsReceive, acknowledge, disseminate, track, report (daily/weekly, and update vulnerability management (VM) alerts, vulnerability assessments, red/blue team events, security incidents, and the VM common operating picture (VM COP)Provide inspection services across the enterprise on behalf of the organization's Special Enclave (SE) program managerSupport or perform global DoD inspections of GENSER and SE (e.g., JWICS) services to ensure compliance to DoDI 8530 standards Skills and TasksExceptionally Complex, Inter-Discipline, Inter-Organizational. Can perform tasks of senior level technicians, specialists, and or managers not performed at Level 3 due to the size and/or complexity of the tasks. Leadership/ManagementMay work individually or as a key member of a senior leadership team. Oversees and monitors performance across several disciplines, and when required, takes steps to resolve issues. title: LINUX Engineer with Security Cleara...
content: The candidate should have demonstrated CI/CD OpenShift experience working at a client site in a high stress environment and deliver measurable results Experience designing and managing CI/CD OpenShift systems in multi-datacenter environments, with HA and DR design experience Be a subject matter expert on OpenShift and container platform, & CI/CD in general Perform day to day support for OpenShift Container Platform Manage all aspects of CI/CD OpenShift environment, including installation, upgrade, patching, and monitoring Must have good scripting experience in at least one of the scripting languages (bash, perl, python, ruby) Be an excellent DevOps team member to integrate CI/CD pipelines with OpenShift Provide technical leadership and technical guidance on all things CI/CD OpenShift Participate in internal workshops and provide presentations of the proposed CI/CD solutions Hands on experience working with Openshift 3.x, 4.x - RBAC, AD/LDAP Integration, CI/CD, Secret Management, Image Scanning, Certificates, SSL/TSL Provide T3 level engineering support for Red Hat Enterprise Linux environment Assist in troubleshooting CI/CD related tasks in OpenShift & Jenkins Working knowledge of Nexus, Docker, Maven, Jenkins, SonarQube, gitlab is a must Understand all elements of the software development life cycle, including planning, development, requirements management, Configuration Management, quality assurance, and release management The candidate must be able to deliver technical documentation and user documentation as required This position may require occasional off hours support to perform upgrades and patches Must be a team player Extensive Knowledge and Experience in a Linux high level of Red Hat: 10+ years Red Hat Engineer/Systems title: Mid Force Protection and Terrorism ...
content: Analyze OSINT, HUMINT, Signal Intelligence (SIGINT) and Imagery Intelligence (IMINT) reporting from a wide variety of sources available through various Government databases to identify current and emerging threats, ascertain the degree and immediacy of those threats, and make reasoned and well-founded conclusions concerning the future evolution of the threats.Seek to identify investigative leads and operational opportunities for possible exploitation by Army CI.Identify intelligence gaps concerning current and emerging threats, and develop intelligence information report evaluations, source-directed requirements, and collection requirements of emphases to focus collection activities against those gaps.Communicate their analytic findings in written assessments, formal analytic notes, briefings with graphics, written inputs to designated intelligence products or responses to RFIs, and informal verbal briefings regarding participation in working groups, conferences, and one-on-one sessions with consumers of intelligence and counterintelligence information.Maintain collaborative contact with their counterparts in the greater intelligence community concerning their analytic efforts and findings to ensure that all threats to the Army and DoD are addressed.Establish regional desks supporting existing production requirements for European Command (EUCOM), Indo-Pacific Command (INDOPACOM), Africa Command (AFRICOM), Central Command (CENTCOM), and the Americas Desk which encompasses both the Southern Command (SOUTHCOM) and Northern Command (NORTHCOM) AORs. Contract analysts shall be teamed with Government analysts to provide regional coverage for the entire Combatant Command (COCOM) AOR.Perform research, analysis and production of FPTAB product lines, including but not limited to the ACIC Terrorism Digest (ATD), Force Protection Analytic Review (FPR), Bi-Weekly Global Sunni Extremist Threat Summary, Bi-Monthly Significant Shia Extremist Threat Update, Force Protection Notes (FPN), ACIC Special Reports (ASR), Army Futures Command CI Digest (ACID), and Special Event Threat Assessments. In addition, contractor personnel shall prepare and present briefings as necessary and provide input to the Army Annual Threat Assessment for their assigned AOR, and respond to RFIs MINIMUM REQUIREMENTS:Employment is contingent upon successful completion of a security background investigation and polygraphBachelor's Degree in a related field (HS Diploma and 4 years of related experience for a total of 12 or Associate's and 2 years of related experience for a total of 10 years may be substituted for a Bachelor's Degree)Minimum 8 years of experience conducting analysis relevant to the position, with at least a portion of the experience within the last 2 yearsGraduate of in-residence Fundamentals of Intelligence Analysis course or Military Service equivalentCOMPANY DESCRIPTION: Clear Resolution Consulting, LLC provides Intelligence Analysis, Business Management, Cyber Operations, Special Operations and Information Technology Consulting Services to the Department of Defense (DoD), Intelligence Community (IC) and other Federal Agencies. This is a full-time position with employee and family medical, dental, and vision plans, life and AD&D insurance, generous holidays and personal leave, 401(K) with company matching, short-term/long-term disability insurance, and tuition assistance. Clear Resolution Consulting, LLC is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex (including pregnancy and gender identity), national origin, political affiliation, sexual orientation, marital status, disability, genetic information, age, membership in an employee organization, retaliation, parental status, military service, any other non-merit factor, or any other characteristic protected by law. title: Network Engineer with Security Clea...
content: Provide support to network related system and component level Trade-Off Analysis & Analysis of Alternatives, and contributes to draft presentations with results and recommendations. Performs engineering services to enable all aspects of network management from network design through implementation, maintenance, sustainment of existing networks, and identification/correction of complex network issues. Performs installation, refresh, and modernization of network components and related services, remotely and on site.  Implements and sustains Campus Area Networks (CANs), with knowledge of Wide Area Networks (WANs), wired and wireless, Data Center Networks/Interfaces (DCN/DCI), Network Security (NETSEC), and Tactical/Deployable Networking Systems. Analyzes design, specifications, and related documents. Implements communication system requirements to support the distributed functionality of a heterogeneous networked enterprise environment with Cisco, Ruckus/Brocade, and Juniper switch gear. Analyzes network characteristics (e.g., traffic connect time, transmission speeds, packet sizes, and throughput, latency, capacity, availability), troubleshoots problems, and recommends modification of network configurations. Provides Tier III network engineering support to a globally distributed services team. title: Telecommunications Network Engineer...
content: Responsible for designing, installing, configuring, monitoring, maintaining network, telecommunications, and/or systems hardware/software; analyzing hardware/software failures, connectivity, and monitoring systems/networks to ensure availability to all users; performing necessary network maintenance, telecommunications, and/or systems availability; and developing/implementing information security policies.  Responsible for designing system architecture templates that will serve as the basis for most customer installations, requiring only minor adjustments (user counts, physical requirements, etc) to meet the needs of those locations.
